Authors:
Hiromu Iwasaki, Toshiyuki Tokiwa, Mayu Shiina, Yukihiro
Asami, Kazuro Shiomi, Satoshi Omura, Kenichi Nonaka
Title:
Metarhizium aciculare, a new hyphomycete (Clavicipitaceae)
from soils in the Izu Islands and the Shizuoka, Japan
Keywords:
Anamorph, Cellulose plate, Oceanic island, Phylogeny,
Soil-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Metarhizium aciculare, a new hyphomycete classified in the
Clavicipitaceae (Hypocreales, Ascomycota), was isolated from soils
collected from the Izu Islands and the kannami town, Shizuoka, Japan.
Using a combination of micro-morphological characteristics and multigene
(SSU, LSU, TEF) phylogenics, the isolates were indentified as a species
of Metarhizium which was previously underdescribed. Phylogenetically the
species is close to M. carneum, but it is distinguished morphologically
from M. carneum by size and surface structure of conidia.
